page.title: 01Burrington - North East
page.content: The section is crossed from the north west corner to centre south by the River Taw, the railway line and the A377 Barnstaple/Exeter road. The River Mole joins the Taw to the south. Both are salmon rivers and fishing rights are bought and sold for large sums of money. The un-manned station at Kingsnympton (formerly named South Molton Road Station) is not near Kingsnympton village but on the A377. A pub, the Fortescue Arms, stands at the junction of the B3226 (from South Molton) with the A377. On the B3226 is Head Mill Trout Farm. This was started some five years ago and is now flourishing, it caters for local trade but also sends fish to large London stores (Harrods). The area is mainly farming - dairy/sheep, with some crops for animal feed. Quite well wooded. On the Taw at Head Wood is a heronry.
